channel.title: Policy & Security Think Tank Updates
channel.description: Custom RSS feed from CSIS, CFR, and other policy institutions

item.title: Ongoing Military Operations Around Venezuela Cost $31 Million per Day—$2.8 Million Is Unbudgeted
item.description: Operation Southern Spear, now in its fourth month, has both a fiscal and an opportunity cost.

item.title: States Weekly: January 21, 2026
item.description: This edition of States Weekly covers January 21, 2026.

item.title: The Geopolitics of Maduro’s Capture: Cuba’s Inflection Point
item.description: CSIS Americas Program Deputy Director and Senior Fellow Christopher Hernandez-Roy assesses the implications of the recent U.S. capture of Nicolás Maduro for Cuba's regime stability and future.

item.title: Victor Cha in Foreign Affairs: South Korea Can Stand Up to China
item.description: South Korea, along with the U.S., Japan, and other allies, has enough leverage to push back against China's economic coercion.
